TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {66654=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 68687=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 65282=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 66948=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 65920=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 65478=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 68201=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 133659=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 66467=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 66280=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 66144=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in section 2303 of this title, 65676=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 23036=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing an interim rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13672, “Further Amendments to Executive Order 11478, Equal Employment Opportunity in the Federal Government, and Executive Order 11246, Equal Employment Opportunity,” and a final rule issued by the Department of Labor (DOL)., 67846=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 68590=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts, 34052=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 66574=§ 2317 - Repealed., 65818=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 67728=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions, 67973=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 65371=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 28547=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 62938=§ 2301 - Repealed. Pub. L. 103–355 , title I , § 1501(a), Oct. 13, 1994, 108 Stat. 3296 ], 63820=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 64599=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 70331=Title 48 published on 2014-10-01, 64843=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 67528=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 66853=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data, 63643=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 68976=§ 2335 - Prohibition on collection of political information, 66750=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 69188=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 68445=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 63094=§ 2302 - Definitions, 67062=§ 2322 - Repealed., 67638=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 128195=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 65577=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 68860=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 69097=§ 2336, 68121=§ 2329 - Repealed., 67142=§ 2323 - Contract goal for small disadvantaged businesses and certain institutions of higher education}

textAfterTable: DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION Final rule. Effective: August 3, 2015. 48 CFR Parts 5 and 22 Summary DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to correct the terminology relating to preparation and transmittal of synopses and update the descriptions of Federal product and service codes related to exemptions from service contract labor standards, to conform to the current Federal Procurement Data System Product and Service Codes Manual. 2015-05-29; vol. 80 # 103 - Friday, May 29, 2015 80 FR 30631 - Application of Labor Laws to Government Acquisitions GPO FDSys XML | Text Additional Documents type regulations.gov FR Doc. 2015-13057 RIN
